metadata.titel_preek: Getting Your Sibilants Right: The Evangelical Shibboleth

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) must learn to correctly pronounce/practice the 'shibboleth' of the gospel—foolishness, weakness, and poverty—to distinguish itself from the deathly wisdom of the world and find life in Christ.

subject.identificatie: The Church / The Preacher / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: we have such a shibboleth that is known to insiders
We are called to live right in the midst of that contradiction
we embrace a metric other than that imposed upon us by the world
the true sibilant of the weakness of God
Paul... gives us what is surely the most eloquent and authoritative presentation of our tribal code
to offer an alternative to the deathly way of the world

helper.identificatie: God / Christ / Exemplars (Mother Teresa, MLK, Pope Francis)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is an agent of such self-giving
He [God] is the source of our life in Christ Jesus
the dominant way of wisdom, power, and wealth
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a 'deathly way' of social and economic organization that the church mistakenly imitates.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (Subject) chooses the foolish and weak (Object) to shame the wise (Opponent).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon oscillates between God choosing us (Soteriology) and us needing to pronounce the sibilant correctly (Ethics), often making the latter the condition for the former.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He [God] is the source of our life
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we can [pronounce it]... and we do!

voorbeelden: assignment is not for the sake of wisdom
know and trust and believe and practice
But we can . . . and we do!

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes that 'knowing' the correct code (Savoir) and recognizing the 'call' (Devoir) enables the 'doing'. It is a gnostic-moralistic structure where correct linguistic/ideological alignment is the primary task.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Worldly Wisdom) to Niet-S1 (Compromise) to S1 (The correct sibilant).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Subject (the church) deciding to adopt the correct 'metric'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; it is seen as a 'mess' but not as a total ontological death requiring a Savior-Subject.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the high-frequency use of 'gospel' and 'Christ', the actantial subject is the Church. The 'Shibboleth' is treated as a tribal code we must get right to avoid the fate of the Ephraimites.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: In order to trust their identity... they had to get the sibilant right.
Jesus is an agent of such self-giving... who could not possibly cut any ice in the real world.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He [God] is the source of our life in Christ Jesus

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mother Teresa, MLK, and Pope Francis are used as 'all-stars' who successfully pronounced the sibilant.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the only one who pronounced the Shibboleth perfectly on our behalf when we said 'Sibboleth'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'correct' dialect of foolishness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation by correct ideological and ethical alignment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon struggles to reconcile the 'God chose us' (Passive) with 'We can and do get it right' (Active).
spanning_punten: The Ephraimites were killed for failing; the preacher says 'we can' do what they couldn't.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is an agent of such self-giving... a totem for the truth.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The preacher assumes the hearer already has the 'Pouvoir' (ability) if they just have the 'Savoir' (knowledge).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is mispronouncing the gospel or being 'prudent' rather than 'foolish'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'linguistic law'. The gospel is reduced to a 'code' the church must master.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The church is the subject of 'getting it right'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ as the Subject who speaks the Shibboleth for us.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We can pronounce it', use 'Christ pronounced the shibboleth of the cross when we were silent in our sin'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with the 42,000 who failed, and Christ as the one who saves the failures.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit enables the foolishness that we cannot manufacture.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Death and the 'accuser' who uses the law (the test) to execute us.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a lethal opponent, grace is just a 'better metric' rather than a rescue.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (the sibilant) precedes and conditions identity.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God's choice (Program 1) creates the new dialect (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The rhetorical brilliance masks a deep structure of performance. Shift the 'active verbs' to God to move from a 'tribal code' to a 'living Gospel'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is masterful in its use of metaphor; semiotically, it is a legalistic mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the 'shibboleth' context, but semiotics reveals the preacher is using the text to impose a new linguistic law.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'foolishness' has become a 'work' (Object) that the Subject (Church) must perform to be 'insiders'.

volledige_subject_lijst: We appeal to a business model
We can [say it]... and we do
appendices.notnotes: The sermon ends on a note of human capability ('we can... and we do'), which directly contradicts the 'weakness' it claims to champion.
